publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1259 Tommy Sheridan: MMR Vaccine—That the Parliament notes the growing body of evidence which suggests a possible link between the triple measles, mumps and rubella (MMR) vaccination and the increased incidence of autism and other disorders in children and calls upon the Scottish Executive to take the necessary steps to provide each of the three vaccines in separate doses, free of charge and on the NHS, as an alternative for those parents who request it for a five year period while further research is conducted into possible links between the MMR vaccine and autism in children.
S1M-1259 MMR Vaccine (lodged on 11 October 2000) Fiona McLeod*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*

S1M-1259 Tommy Sheridan: MMR Vaccine—That the Parliament notes the growing body of evidence which suggests a possible link between the triple measles, mumps and rubella (MMR) vaccination and the increased incidence of autism and other disorders in children and calls upon the Scottish Executive to take the necessary steps to provide each of the three vaccines in separate doses, free of charge and on the NHS, as an alternative for those parents who request it for a five year period while further research is conducted into possible links between the MMR vaccine and autism in children. Supported by: Fiona McLeod, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Ms Sandra White*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*
S1M-1259 MMR Vaccine (lodged on 11 October 2000) Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Irene McGugan*
S1M-1259 MMR Vaccine (lodged on 11 October 2000) Christine Grahame*, Linda Fabiani*, Shona Robison*

Supported by: Fiona McLeod, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Ms Sandra White, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Adam Ingram, Irene McGugan, Christine Grahame, Linda Fabiani, Shona Robison
S1M-1259 MMR Vaccine (lodged on 11 October 2000) Alex Neil*
S1M-1259 MMR Vaccine (lodged on 11 October 2000) Michael Matheson*
